caption: Apostille service is incredibly efficient and fast. It works from 9am to 1pm. There is an electronic queue. One should keep in mind that they accept to apostle right away only 5 documents per person. Besides, think about visiting the grandiose building of the court itself and walk around Sainte Chapelle.

Cour de cassation is one of the four courts of last resort in France. It has jurisdiction over all civil and criminal matters triable in the judicial system, and is the supreme court of appeal in these cases. It has jurisdiction to review the law, and to certify qestions of law, to determine miscarriages of justice. The Court is located in the Palace of Justice in Paris.

The Court of Appeal of Paris (Fr: Cour d'appel de Paris) is the largest appeals court in France in terms of the number of cases brought before it. Its jurisdiction covers the departments of Paris, Essonne, Yonne, Seine-et-Marne, Seine-Saint-Denis, and the Val de Marne.  The Court is housed in the Palais de Justice of Paris. Jacques Degrandi has been the president of the Court since 2010.
Nice

I went there to have my certificate of completion of the engineering diploma apostille which I had previously had certified as true to the original in a town hall in 94. I went there 40 minutes before opening from the apostille service (waiting tickets start going out at 8:45 a.m.) and so I left very quickly with my apostille document. For my part, a very positive experience.

Yesterday (09/10/24) I visited this institution. The three reception staff provided quick and efficient service to everyone. Opened at 8.30. The line moved quickly.  I managed to stand in line twice because I ran out to look for a notary in Paris and have my documents certified.  I am very pleased with their work! Bravo!

As a lawyer it is very unpleasant not to be able to reach the registry by telephone... "Telephone reception is available from 9 a.m. to noon and from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m.", but when you call at 9:30 a.m., 10 a.m., 11 a.m., 2 p.m. and the rest of the afternoon without ever any response, we realize that this standard is quite useless

Most of the children of the wicked work in particular in transplants. Although, I have nothing to do with them. They make mistakes in documents and are distracted, just to seek the services of lawyers.     Attention....

I have a summons in August, what is your phone used for? I have called 70 times, I have reception transfer the call to me and it is impossible to reach you, even by email either. I need answers urgently and you are away. Where do our taxes go?

I arrived at 10am to get an apostille. I waited in line for an hour outside waiting to get in, which was extremely slow. Once I managed to get in, I went to the apostille department, and they told me there were no more numbers "because it was too late"... it was 11am and the service is open between 9 a.m. and 1 p.m. It's ridiculous.
Very beautiful place, the staff is polite and pleasant

Visit to the apostille reception for the legalization of three documents. The service was incapable with a very short wait (month of August so probably less demand, but also agents likely to be on vacation) very well managed using waiting tickets. The welcome was friendly, the service efficient and immediate.  Finally, the building is of course exceptional and it is a pleasure to carry out administrative procedures in such a setting.
Extreme slowness to enter. At least the apostille office is fast and also free. If you come to do any paperwork, come early and be very patient.

The switchboard is open from nine o'clock, I've been waiting for almost two hours To go through reception and there's only the voicemail and no one answers, it looks like no one works at the court. What will it be like my trial will start there? It was for very important information before starting my procedure and would say that no one who works at the courtü§îü§îü§îü§î

Once very competent and responsive, the apostille service has lost its efficiency and, above all, its sense of public service. That deadlines are extended is understandable, but responding to emails requesting information in a correct and polite manner is no more complicated than sending a cold and contemptuous email.
Thanks for the efficiency. More than 2 hours waiting for someone to pick up while listening to the same irritating message...

I went there today to have an apostille affixed to a legal document for which I had previously obtained a certified copy. I went there very early and it went super quickly. The people at the counters are efficient and pleasant. Thank you for your advice via email exchanges ü•∞
A huge thank you to the ranch for this exquisite raclette!!! Special mention to Walid server at the top of the bestüëå ‚Ä¶

Despite an obvious overload of work in the apostille service, the people at the counter receiving the public remain charming and take the time to explain things to someone who is not experienced in administrative procedures. Thank you ladies for your availability.

I've been trying to contact the switchboard for 4 days. 45 minutes each time and no response. I will try a registered letter with acknowledgment of receipt. I hope there is an answer. Otherwise I see that the reception is efficient on site.
THE LIST OF EXPERTS IS NOT EVEN UP TO DATE!  experts who no longer practice... WHAT ARE YOU FOR?????

It's a disaster! Impossible to contact pole 6 room 1. For several weeks, I have been trying to contact the pole in question. In vain! On the other hand, the lady at the switchboard is sylo5et professional!
Very efficient on-site apostille process. 13 people in front of me, I waited 30 minutes. Flawless !

What is happening? Is the apostille service valid? No return letter for 1 month (deadline announced on the site exceeded). They don't answer the phone (their permanence telephone number is only from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m.). We have to move by force and lose half a day of work for a simple stamp??? Are we in PARIS or in the third world?  Ps: No problem with the Rennes Court of Appeal, return of AR received in 3 days for another document... so there is a real problem that must be resolved urgently!!!!!

Very poorly managed Apostille service: - 2 counters open to accommodate around a hundred people in 4 hours (9 a.m.-1 p.m.) - they stopped taking people at 12:45 p.m. (the service officially ended at 1 p.m.) - very poor signage, which consists of a few sheets that are difficult to read, taped to a door. - The counter closes without warning the ten people still waiting in the waiting room. - No pen available to fill out the document for the postal service.  It is absolutely necessary to review the signage (barely visible and understandable) as well as the ticket system which should indicate to the patient that depending on the number of people before him, he will be taken at no. Wasting 1h30 of your time so as not to be received in the end while you are still on time under any valid pretext is simply unacceptable.

Justice dead! everyone is thieves and corrupt, starting with the lawyers! It's really very rare to come across honest people! I will not forgive everyone who participated in the theft of my money! I hope that life will make you pay dearly for it!

Thank you to Magistrate Madame Nathalie Renard for showing humanity by issuing an order restoring the right to my son. I salute the dedication of this Magistrate who worked non-stop, carrying out hearings from morning to evening without losing her serenity. Well done !

Disastrous public service staff does not answer the phone on 3 numbers still waiting for a document after more than a month of waiting, what is happening? Does the operator announced when there is no response exist?

Lawyer at the Court of Paris! ...  this ‚Äútelephone reception‚Äù at 01.44.32.52.52 is a decoy; no one ever picks up the phone; the Ministry of Justice could search among many competent unemployed people for people who would effectively meet the standard for a great nation like France, it's pathetic

Apostille service extremely cantankerous and unfriendly, in addition to being sometimes incompetent (not up to date with the latest ICC provisions regarding legalization, thus refusing valid documents). Allow themselves to treat people very badly and throw away papers for daring to look at the phone for 2 seconds, when it is clearly not made clear that this is prohibited.

In the professional context, I have tried time and again to contact the Paris Court of Appeal for a simple copy of the divorce judgment. After more than a year of following up with them, sending letters, calling so that in the end they would hang up on me, sending emails etc... it was necessary to send a registered letter so that these ladies and gentlemen would finally deign to answer me . I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs their organization that is failing but in any case it‚Äôs CATASTROPHIC!!!

I have tried to call every day since 08/23, telephone reception is available from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m. and from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. but no one ever picks up, it doesn't even ring!! Unacceptable administration!!!!
Apostille service understaffed and endless waiting. Arrival at 9 a.m. for a passage at 11:15 a.m., it is not possible to take a morning for an apostille.
The Apostille service is simply remarkable. The staff is very welcoming. Thank you for your professionalism. Carrying out administrative procedures in this wonderful place is simply a real pleasure.

Very happy with my visit to the court, coming for a serious matter, I waited in line (Vigipirate+ Covid 19 Plan). At reception, a secretary gave me good information on how to get him to the courtroom. I showed the supporting documents and found the staff involved, even the police officers are very nice and serious. I went there from September 1 to 4. I found the places magnificent, and the toilets clean (contrary to what is said above). As for the case itself, there was a 14-year wait, between the facts and the court decision, but everything was done to resolve all of that. Ah, I forgot, I wanted to contact the clerk, I had some difficulty getting through to her but I had no trouble getting someone online. A little advice for those who have difficulty getting someone online: Ask for the email address of the clerk or in other cases, the judge. This saves you time and usually the person responds quickly.

‚ÄúHello, you are at the Paris Court of Appeal. Telephone support is available Monday to Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m...." It's Friday, it's 2 p.m. and I've been waiting for 28 minutes. Nobody answers. Telephone reception does not seem to be guaranteed, as the answering machine says.

We are given a form online and when we write the message it is directly destroyed for very strange reasons with articles of law that we understand nothing about, fines, etc. Why not put an email address by service, this would save a lot of worries for simple, very deprived citizens that we are faced with public services that do not work as is the case for me today with the Court of Appeal, it's desperate!!! Not only does no one respond in the department concerned, at 11:55 a.m., normally, they have all already gone to the canteen... and when we want to send our request by email, it is automatically refused by the "DGST" services!! ??
